snippet: Hundreds of patients, including illegal immigrants, who are well enough to be discharged have languished in city hospitals for months or years because there is nowhere to send them.
abstract: Hundreds of patients, including illegal immigrants, who are well enough to be discharged have languished in New York City hospitals for months or years because they lack sufficient insurance and there is nowhere to send them; hospitals are absorbing millions of dollars in unreimbursed expenses annually while patients are deprived of services that could be provided elsewhere at a small fraction of the cost.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of patients, including illegal immigrants, who are well enough to be discharged have languished in city hospitals for months or years because there is nowhere to send them.

headline.seo: Nowhere to Go, Patients Linger in Hospitals, at a High Cost
headline.main: Nowhere to Go, Patients Linger in Hospitals, at a High Cost
headline.print_headline: Nowhere to Go, Patients Linger In Hospitals, At a High Cost
